intro: Macropanax parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered macropanax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its palmately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short peduncles. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
